Admissions Officer

Company Name Westbourne Grammar School Company Location Truganina, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 41 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

  • Join a dedicated and well-resourced team, supporting a strong tradition of academic excellence
  • Enjoy a convenient location in Melbourne's West.


A leading independent, coeducational school in the heart of Melbourne's fast-growing west, Westbourne's innovative learning culture is underpinned by a strong tradition of academic excellence and student achievement. Working at Westbourne means you will be welcomed into a supportive community where you will be part a thriving culture of professional growth and advancement.


Committed to achieving the best possible outcomes for the school, Westbourne Grammar's professional, non-teaching staff are members of a highly valued, dedicated and well-resourced team.


Westbourne seeks applications from enthusiastic professionals who support the school's vision and values and who will actively contribute to its twenty-first century goals and aspirations.


The school is only a 20-minute drive from the City and 40 minutes from Geelong. All staff are allocated a designated parking space on the campus at Truganina.


About the role


As our Admissions Officer, you will be responsible for the day-to-day administration of student enquiries and enrolments.

You will take direction from the Admissions Manager to ensure that all processes pertaining to both domestic and international enrolments run smoothly and are conducted in accordance with the relevant legislation.


Your responsibilities will include:


  • Addressing enquiries from prospective student families and sending enrolment information
  • Assisting with tours around the school and addressing placement enquiries
  • Reporting and analysing student numbers and enrolment data, including forecasting trends
  • Managing the school's wait list
  • Working with international agents and families on international enrolments


About You


You are seeking a unique role that will utilise your excellent communication skills and high level of numerical competence in equal measure.


You ideally have 5+ years of experience in a customer facing senior administration role. Your background could be in schools and education, or a professional services environment where meticulous attention to detail and customer focus are paramount.

You will enjoy maintaining accurate databases and have worked with database software previously. Knowledge of schools management software, particularly Synergetic, would be a distinct benefit.


Importantly, you are someone who likes to take a big picture view and support the management team's strategy and forward planning. Your advanced knowledge of MS Excel will help you prepare enrolment trend reports and forecast data to this end.

You will enjoy access to an onsite creche, discounts on school fees and 5 weeks leave.


If you share our philosophy and want to be part of a great community, apply now. This is a full time role commencing in October.


To apply for this job go to: www.westbourne.recruitmenthub.com.au

Applications close 24 September 2018

Marketplace Planning & Analytics Manager

Company Name Nike Company Location Melbourne, Australia

New Posted Date Posted 22 hours ago Number of views 200 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Nike Pacific is seeking a highly experienced Marketplace Planning & Analytics Manager\xa0to join the Pacific Demand & Supply Management team.


Reporting directly to the Director of Demand & Supply Management, this role will see you partner with key stakeholders to define and lead the Territory Reporting and Analytics strategy, and deliver on Territory goals. This role is pivotal as a critical enabler to the business.
\xa0

Key responsibilities of the role include:

  • Lead and inspire the Marketplace Intelligence team, along with key stakeholders within the Pacific business and Geography counterparts
  • Define and execute the Pacific Point of Sale (POS) strategy, thereby increasing POS coverage through an account/partner acquisition and implementation plan
  • Lead the execution and consolidation of all Pacific marketplace reporting deliverables, providing high level analytics and recommendations across the total marketplace
  • Leverage global dashboards and standard reports on marketshare and macroeconomic data, to create high level views of marketplace performance
  • Partner with cross-functional teams and the Nike Pacific Leadership Team to understand key Retail and Wholesale business health metrics, identifying risks and opportunities in the Pacific Marketplace.


About you

We are looking for someone who has:

  • A tertiary degree in Business, Finance, Sales, Marketing or related field
  • Proven experience in Reporting, Buying, Planning, Allocation and/or Vendor Sales for a multi-store retailer
  • Comprehensive understanding of Retail math and Marketplace Health metrics
  • Ability to create weekly and monthly reports and drive innovation to exceed needs of stakeholders
  • Ability to interpret financial sales data to make decisions and recommendations that impact the business
  • Demonstrated experience leading and developing teams to achieve goals and objectives
  • Experience in developing an understanding of customers, competitors and retail trends; knowledge of the sports apparel and footwear market highly desirable
  • Strong and demonstrated ability to effectively communicate and influence others, along with strong presentation skills
  • Advanced abilities in all Microsoft Office applications
  • Experience with COGNOS & Tableau is highly regarded.


What we can offer you

NIKE, Inc. is a growth company that looks for team members to grow with it. Nike offers a generous total rewards package, casual work environment, a diverse and inclusive culture, and an electric atmosphere for professional development. No matter the location, or the role, every Nike employee shares one galvanizing mission: To bring inspiration and innovation to every athlete* in the world.

859225365:
[

Product Trainer

Company Name dotmailer Company Location Melbourne, Victoria, Australia

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 193 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

We’re looking for a Trainer to join our growing team at dotmailer (www.dotmailer.com). dotmailer is the UK’s largest and a global provider of email and marketing automation email services. Our market-leading platform empowers our clients’ marketing and ecommerce teams to create engaging and relevant email marketing programmes. We continue to experience exciting growth in our business since we began in 1999. As part of our continued growth, we have expanded our operations across the UK, Eastern Europe, USA and Asia Pacific. With offices in London, Manchester, Sydney, Melbourne, Cape Town, Belarus & New York.

Our contemporary workspace and strong team working ethic promotes creativity and collaboration across all teams and offices. We offer a competitive salary package, a great working environment and the opportunity to become part of a thriving and rapidly growing, award winning company.


You’ll be training our clients on all features of dotmailer as well as email marketing and marketing automation best practices, following a defined curriculum to deliver standard training as well as delivering bespoke training courses for key clients. You will work closely with the Customer Success Team locally and be part of a wider global Training Team with colleagues based in the UK, and US.


The trainer will be responsible for delivering training across the Asia Pacific region. Face to face training will take place at client offices, which depending on client requirements may be regionally or internationally based. While remote training will be telephone or web-based. You’ll be required to deliver training to a varying level of abilities and experience, sometimes within the same session. You should be able to identify participants’ skill level and vary your training accordingly. The training function is an integral part of our overall customer success efforts and you should be able to identify potential client issues and proactively highlight these to the appropriate account manager as well as spot and drive opportunities to cross-sell additional services including additional training.

\xa0

Skills and experience:

One to two years’ experience in delivering technical and best practice training

Proactive and confident in unexpected situations

Experienced in building strong positive relationships both with colleagues and clients

Organised, with strong time management skills

Happy to work flexibly

A self-starter with a strong focus on attention to detail

Experience of email marketing systems would be welcomed but full training will be given

Understanding of CRM systems (in particular Salesforce or MS Dynamics), direct marketing and/or data and databases would be advantageous

Experience of the Magento, Shopify or other ecommerce solutions would be advantageous

863967663:
[

Platform Optimisation Manager

Company Name Amobee Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 43 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

About Amobee

Amobee is a technology company that transforms the way brands and agencies make marketing decisions. The Amobee Marketing Platform enables marketers to plan and activate cross channel, programmatic media campaigns using real-time market research, proprietary audience data, advanced analytics, and more than 150 integrated partners, including Facebook, Instagram, Pinterest, Snapchat and Twitter. Amobee is a wholly owned subsidiary of Singtel, one of the largest communications technology companies in the world which reaches over 640 million mobile subscribers. The company operates across North America, Europe, Middle East, Asia and Australia. For more information, visit amobee.com or follow @amobee

Position Overview

The Platform Optimisation Manager will be assigned to specific client (Agency, Trading Desk, Brand Advertiser) accounts and will be primarily responsible for driving client adoption of the Amobee Marketing Platform through post-sale activation and implementation. This involves the Optimisation Manager working closely with client teams to train and evangelize the Amobee tool set and assist in campaign set-up and management. It's expected this role will spend 2-3 days a week minimum on-site with the client to ensure maximum uptake and utilisation of the Amobee Marketing Platform. The Platform Optimisation Manager is teamed with an Account Manager and Sales lead to ensure that platform adoption is taking place and that Amobee is meeting and exceeding client expectations.

Simply put, the Platform Optimisation Manager is responsible for making Amobee customers successful by adding significant value to their business through adoption of the Amobee Marketing Platform.

Responsibilities
  • This is a client facing position that requires maintaining strong communication with clients to properly explain Amobee platform tools and campaign management best practices.
  • Formal and ad hoc self-service client trainings on all Amobee Marketing Platform tools.
  • Articulate optimal campaign set up and tagging requirements by platform (desktop, mobile, tablet, CTV) to clients for varying buy set ups (Open RTB, PMPs, Direct Guaranteed).
  • Assist Platform Enablement, Sales Engineering, and Sales Directors with inventory design and tech set up for all client integration requests.
  • Troubleshooting and solving common technical problems, and addressing client issues.
  • Providing comprehensive account analysis, and simplifying complex scenarios to produce client proficiency & success.
  • Monitoring campaign performance to meet client objectives and consult on optimization recommendations as necessary.
  • Maintaining and expanding both client and internal relationships; notifying stakeholders about future business opportunities.
  • Developing and maintaining expert level proficiency across the Amobee tool set.
  • Serve as a liaison with clients regarding new product launches and advertising opportunities while ensuring clients are satisfied with their business performance and growth.
  • Staying ahead of the industry knowledge curve in regards to key platforms, new technology and developing trends.


Qualifications
  • 3-4+ years of experience in a relevant client management position.
  • Proven success in managing client relationships and extraordinary client service.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
  • Proficiency within the online media buying and selling ecosystem, and a strong understanding of DSPs, SSPs, Exchanges, DMPs, & Measurement Providers.
  • Experience in management of programmatic ad delivery, optimization and/or yield management as well as working with, in, and speaking to tech implementation and tagging integrations.
  • Ability to prioritize multiple tasks and meet deadlines with demonstrated initiative.
  • Strong initiative and ability to work well under pressure while maintaining a good attitude.
  • Strong analytical skills, including the ability to synthesize and decipher data, and the wherewithal to leverage insights to produce solutions.
  • Ability to work well independently; define/manage objectives in a fast paced, ever-changing environment.
  • Ability to collaborate within a team, and alongside key stakeholders from various internal groups.
  • Ability to maintain excellent internal and external client relationships.
  • Proficiency in MS Office Suite, with an emphasis in Excel
  • BA/BS degree

Location: Melbourne, Australia

In addition to our great environment, we offer a competitive base salary, employee development programs and other comprehensive benefits. Please send a cover letter along with your resume when applying to the position of interest located at Amobee.com. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. No phone calls and no recruiting agencies, please.

Seniority Level

Mid-Senior level

Industry

  • Marketing and Advertising
  • Computer Software
  • Internet

Employment Type

Full-time

  • Advertising
  • Marketing
  • Consulting

HR Advisor

Company Name GSK Company Location Melbourne, AU

Posted Date Posted 4 days ago Number of views 154 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

Your Responsibilities

Due to two internal promotions we are now looking for an HR Advisor to join our busy HR Response team in Abbotsford. You will actively support the achievement of business objectives by providing an effective and professional HR service to all GSK ANZ employees. You will act as a first point of contact between HR and the business by responding to day to day requests and queries.

Key responsibilities include
  • Partner with the HR Shared Services teams in providing highest quality service
  • Work closely with HR colleagues across the business to monitor, review and update all policies in line with current legislation and best practice
  • Monitor issues and climate and make recommendations and develop solutions, in partnership with the HR Service Team Leader and other HR team members.
  • Review processes and systems with a view to continuously improve the efficiency of HR processes
  • Processing employee movements including hires, promotions, terminations and secondments in HRIS
  • Liaising with Payroll, HR Consultants and HR Business Partners across Australia and New Zealand
  • Assisting HR Business Leads with ad hoc projects and individual cases
To be successful in this role you will be an effective communicator and have the ability to liaise with stakeholders at all levels. You will have a degree qualification in HR/Business/Commerce or related discipline and 2 years experience within an HR role. Knowledge of HR policies and processes including the Fair Work Act is essential.

In return, we can offer you a rewarding culture that values you, focuses on your career progression, and makes you an integral part of our success.

If you’re looking to make a difference and enjoy a #careerwithpurpose then please click on the link below.

At GSK we value diversity and treat all candidates equally. We aim to create an inclusive workplace where all employees feel engaged, supportive of one another, and know their work makes an important contribution.

Why You?
Bachelors in HR/Business/Commerce or similar
2 years HR experience


Why GSK?
GlaxoSmithKline (GSK) is a science-led healthcare company, with a proud history in Australia dating back to 1886. Our mission is to improve the quality of human life by enabling people to do more, feel better and live longer.

Contact information

GSK does not accept referrals from employment businesses and/or employment agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site. All employment businesses/agencies are required to contact GSK's commercial and general procurement/human resources department to obtain prior written authorization before referring any candidates to GSK. The obtaining of prior written authorization is a condition precedent to any agreement (verbal or written) between the employment business/ agency and GSK. In the absence of such written authorization being obtained any actions undertaken by the employment business/agency shall be deemed to have been performed without the consent or contractual agreement of GSK. GSK shall therefore not be liable for any fees arising from such actions or any fees arising from any referrals by employment businesses/agencies in respect of the vacancies posted on this site.
